Man page:
EXIT_GROUP(2)             Linux Programmer's Manual            EXIT_GROUP(2)

NAME 


       exit_group - exit all threads in a process

SYNOPSIS 


       #include <linux/unistd.h>

       void exit_group(int status);

DESCRIPTION 


       This system call is equivalent to exit(2) except that it terminates
       not only the calling thread, but all threads in the calling process's
       thread group.

RETURN VALUE 


       This system call does not return.

VERSIONS 


       This call is present since Linux 2.5.35.

CONFORMING TO 


       This call is Linux-specific.

NOTES 


       Since glibc 2.3, this is the system call invoked when the exit(2)
       wrapper function is called.

SEE ALSO 


       exit(2)
